opener.salute: Servant | Mr John TompsonThus in MS; added in another hand. John Thompson (1821-71), CD’s man-servant.

body.p: Mr Charles Dickens sends his compliments to the Master of the Crown Hotel at Rochester, and begs to say that he wishes to secure for tomorrow and Sunday, a comfortable Private Sitting room – a bedroom for himself and Mrs Dickens – another for a young ladyGeorgina Hogarth (1827-1917), CD’s sister-in-law. – and two more for two gentlemenDouglas Jerrold and Daniel Maclise, although CD’s letter to Emile de la Rue (dated 16 February 1846) states that Maclise did not join the party, which was in celebration of CD’s birthday; see Pilgrim Letters who will accompany them.4 Also dinner for five personsAdded over caret. at five o’Clock tomorrow,Added over caret. with Soup and Fish. Mr Dickens intends to come down by the Twelve o’Clock Gravesend Boat from Blackheath.
